pros: Wonderful environment, supportive and enriching co-workers and mentors, and varied tasks. Helped me learn a lot of helpful skills in a fun atmosphere.
cons: While they have incremental raises, pay is still too low (I went from 8.00 to 8.75 over four years).

pros: The employees are very helpful and willing to help. Definitely a family atmosphere
cons: The salary was on the lower end of the position.

review_title: Could be better but not the worse
job_title: Technical Analyst II in Montevallo, AL
pros: Great pay and job opportunities, especially considering the rural area. Very welcoming culture, especially if you are related to or are alumni. Great benefits.
cons: Extremely disorganized. Hires under qualified individuals for job positions and then does not train well. Large divide between back end support and front end support. Front end supported needed better train workers.

pros: The leadership goes the extra mile for faculty and staff.
cons: The political environment in the State may not be very conducive to a liberal arts institution.

job_title: Office of Student Life Office Assistant in Montevallo, AL
pros: Flexible; Allows me to work around my class schedule. Amazing bosses.
cons: That I can't work here forever.

Dealing with mental health crises

pros: Wonderful environment to work in

pros: Great atmosphere. Excellent flexibility and autonomy.

pros: Friendly staff members, helps you to learn new skills and develop communication skills.
cons: Long commute if you live outside Montevallo.

pros: Small class sizes and students ready to learn.
cons: Very small institution, many individuals serve multiple roles.

review_title: Strong academics and great benefits, but limited opportunities and support for staff
pros: Beautiful campus; strong academic reputation and programming; strong student-centered campus; very open and welcoming campus atmosphere for diversity; outstanding faculty and staff who care about students; great benefits including tuition waivers and time off; loyal faculty, staff, and alumni.
cons: Not much room for career advancement; not enough cross-campus engagement/interaction; not enough employee recognition or opportunities for staff development; administration is out of touch with campus morale; many feel overworked with too much responsibility and not enough support.

pros: Fulfilment, good relationships with co-workers, frequent employee appreciation events, beautiful work setting; and if you're full-time, a chance to take university classes for free or reduced tuition
cons: At times, a work environment that is too relaxed and productivity too low; sometimes seemingly endless projects that could drain your motivation to achieve a goal.

pros:
Everyone is there to help you be the best RA possible, there's  always  an amazing housing staff and directors. 
the benefits are great for an undergrad or grad student.
cons:
hours can be long and nights can be sleepless during the weekend. 
having a planner and being organized is vital to success.

review_title: Heavy workload, low salary, but good sense of community among faculty and students
pros: Strong sense of community among faculty; beautiful campus; great parking
cons: Management not willing to bring salaries up to par or deal with ineffective supervisors

pros: Great recitals multiple times per year for students. Other great teachers who are well qualified.
cons: Far away from most other things. Needed full time Director.

pros: Beautiful campus, staff is warm and caring, small size
cons: Faculty can be difficult to work with, distance from Birmingham

pros: Small school. friendly faculty, staff and students. All around amazing

pros: UM is a wonderful institution with a growing community.
cons: The downfall is that it's difficult to prepare to leave the area in search of a career.

pros: Loved this job, it was very flexible. My boss was the best!
